intro: Hemitelia latipinnula, commonly known as the broad-pinnate hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with broad, spreading leaflets. It produces small, white to yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Hemitelia latipinnula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
